page.title: 02Home Life-the TV's effects.
page.content: In the 1950s the relatively new television was blamed for damaging "live" entertainment, such as that provided by the theatre, by keeping families at home. In the 1980s there are the first signs that television may be affecting family life in the Rainhill area. A survey of a mixed class of 28 thirteen year olds unsurprisingly indicated that watching television occupied between 4 and 5 hours every weekday evening, considerably more at weekends. The relative affluence of the Rainhill area allows 27 families to own 2 or more sets, one family having the unusually large number of six!
